message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.AR, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper proposes a novel approach to unify cable and wireless cellular access networks using the HFC cable network infrastructure as fiber fronthaul network for cellular wireless services. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is also likely as the paper proposes a novel remote-fast-Fourier transform (R-FFT) node that conducts the physical layer processing from the FFT module toward the RF transmission, whereby DOCSIS and LTE share a common FFT module. 
- cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) is another likely category as the paper discusses the physical layer processing for transmissions over the broadcast cable in a remote node and proposes a unified access network for DOCSIS and LTE services. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) is a possible category as the paper proposes a novel R-FFT node for conducting physical layer processing. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a possible category as the paper discusses the delay implications of moving part of the cable R-PHY remote node physical layer processing to the headend.
